adjectives.description: animated (comparative more animated, superlative most animated)

entries.meaning: Full of life or spirit; lively; vigorous; spritely.

examples: Throughout animated Nature, of each characteristic Organ and Faculty there exists a preassurance, an instinctive and practical anticipation; and no preassurance common to a whole species does in any instance prove delusive.

entries.meaning: Composed of inanimate objects or drawings that appear to move through the use of computer graphics or stop-action filming.
simple past tense and past participle of animate
